page.title: 09HOUSING IN LAYER BRETON
page.content: There are approximately 106 houses in the area, the majority being privately owned, with only a small percentage of council owned property which is rented to the tenants. The houses vary considerably in size and style, ranging from very small old cottages, some of which are situated in secluded positions, to the larger Georgian style houses. In recent years the village has been extended with the building of modern properties, but further development is expected to be restricted.A lot of the older houses have been renovated but retain much of their original form. The general appearance of the village is very pleasant, due in part to the well kept gardens many of which are of the older 'cottage style'. The main source of energy supplied to the properties is electricity.
